metadata.Title: CVE-2022-37026 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Erlang/OTP before 23.3.4.15, 24.x before 24.3.4.2, and 25.x before 25.0.2, there is a Client Authentication Bypass in certain client-certification situations for SSL, TLS, and DTLS. It was discovered that Erlang did not properly implement TLS client certificate validation during the TLS handshake. A remote attacker could use this issue to bypass client authentication.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> only an issue when client certificates are used

criterions.comment: erlang: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
